sec.title: Instructions for the use of the rig
sec.p: The operator's instructions shall contain at least the following information and instructions for the intended use of the rig on the following topics, where applicable.

list-item.label: a)
list-item.p: General:
specification of the intended use of the machine;
complete instructions for the operation of the machine;
warnings against actions which can cause injuries to the operator or other personnel.

list-item.label: b)
list-item.p: Working environment:
the temperature range for which the rig is designed;
instructions to remove ice under sub-zero temperature conditions;
instructions for the use of equipment for monitoring the ambient atmospheric conditions when working in a confined space.

list-item.label: c)
list-item.p: Personal protection equipment:
instructions for personal protective equipment (PPE);
instructions on the use of safety harnesses, anchoring points and escape equipment.

list-item.label: d)
list-item.p: Training required:
operators shall be given practical training in the operation of the rig with special emphasis on safety precautions.

list-item.label: e)
list-item.p: Setting up:
modular assembly and disassembly of the rig;
location of retrieving points, permissible forces, the correct use when towing and maximum towing speed and distance;
safety precautions to be taken when transporting, assembling and dismantling the rig, parts and attachments;
erection and securing of drilling masts, derricks and feed beams;
residual risks that remain and the prevention measures that shall be taken by the user.

list-item.label: f)
list-item.p: Driving, tramming and operating position:
figure showing the hazard zones of the rig during tramming;
visibility information for the operator’s instructions in accordance with ISO 5006:2017, Clause 12;
instructions to restrict access during any slewing movements;
limitation of conditions for tramming shall be given, if applicable.

list-item.label: g)
list-item.p: Controls, functions, systems and devices:
the need to check the emergency stops and trip devices for their proper function before start of each shift and after tramming.

list-item.label: h)
list-item.p: Stability:
full information on matters of stability, so as to enable proper parking, driving and operation of the rig;
maximum allowed gradient angle for parking, drilling and tramming conditions;
specific instructions for tramming on slopes, including the use of the winch;
the minimum wind speed, above which it is necessary to stop drilling and put the rig in parking position, where applicable;
the measures which are necessary when the wind force exceeds the value allowed for parked and out of service condition, where applicable;
maximum ground pressure occurring under working conditions.

list-item.label: i)
list-item.p: Protection against moving parts:

instructions shall be given how to replace drill rods, pipes and bits in a safe way with the help of the rotation mechanism and other auxiliary means which are available, for example when threading or doing extension drilling;
if the application of the rig does not allow the use of a mechanised drilling consumable handling system or lifting device, the manufacturer shall specify instructions for use;
figures showing the hazard zones of the rig during drilling;
information about the required no access area for a remotely controlled or unmanned, automatically operated rig;
instructions for remote control operation specifying that the operator shall be able to observe the drilling process while operating;
information about the safe area from which the operator can control the rig with the remote control box, e.g. safety distance between the operator and the rig;
information about residual hazards.

list-item.label: j)
list-item.p: Electrical installations:
information on any circuits still connected to their energy sources when the mains power is switched off.

list-item.label: k)
list-item.p: Machines powered by diesel engine:
instruction for operating rigs in confined conditions specifying that the exhaust gases shall be directed in such a way that they do not return to the working area and create a hazard.

list-item.label: l)
list-item.p: Noise and vibration:
the A-weighted sound pressure level at the operator's position, if exceeding 70 dB, measured as specified in Annex C. Should the sound pressure level not exceed 70 dB, this shall be indicated;
the A-weighted continuous sound power level emitted by the machine, as measured in accordance with Annex C, if the A-weighted emission sound pressure level at any workstation exceeds 80 dB;
vibration information in accordance with Annex D.

list-item.label: m)
list-item.p: Winches and ropes:
a load/speed diagram for the winches and draw-works.
